page.title: 05Wingate - Telephone Exchange
page.content: Recently a{new telephone exchange was{opened}in Wingate.{Normally}the automatic exchange building is {unmanned,}but often the manager and his engineers are there installing new lines and checking for faults. The exchange was{built in 1982.}It took{three years to install the {equipment.}It was impossible to count all the wires we could see. There are about{two thousand lines}serving only Wingate. It is{powered by special batteries which run from the main electricity supply, but it has its own{standby {generator}in case of a power cut. In an emergency, 'phones always have to be working.{Each line has a meter which is{photographed when the bills {are due}so that any queries can be answered. Until this exchange was built it was an operator only service.
